location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 16 to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: A slim portion of text is missing on the right-hand side of Page 9.

mods.abstract: The text of the letter is very similar to John Beaumont's letter to William Digges Latouche and George Abraham dated 2 January 1779 (item IOR/R/15/1/3, p 8). The letter states that a request for further intelligence has been sent to Congoon. The letter asks for wool from Europe and states that accounts from July-December are enclosed (they are not included in the file). Shipped by Colonel Capper on a Bunderick [Bandar-e Rig] Dow.
